cons: hierarchical, poor program vision, confused leadership, negligible growth and learning.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: -The mission and work that Room to Read does is truly excellent and transformational for children across the world -The people here are the best of the best -- so many kind, passionate and hard-working colleagues -Great benefits, including full healthcare coverage and 401k matching
cons: -Despite ongoing efforts, there continues to be a major lack of clear processes, making projects chaotic with way too many people involved -Management expects staff to continue to take on more and more work without hiring additional support. This leads to widespread burnout and exhaustion. -The path to promotions and growth is very unclear and certain departments and teams are heavily favored in receiving promotion opportunities.

pros: Recognition of contribution Innovative delivery

pros: Nice salary Culture Salary on time

pros: - Great co-workers - Flexible Schedule (Remote) - Good benefits and PTO - Excellent Mission and Values

pros: Really great mission, talented team members, a desire to be a thought leader in the education sector. Easy to get on board with the work they do in developing nations.
cons: Work life balance is not possible, as senior leadership does not exemplify or support these values. Depending on which team you are on and who is your manager, you will have a completely different experience. Turnover is high due to burnout.

pros: Everyone is so kind, passionate and dedicated. I love learning from my international coworkers, who bring diverse talent and expertise. The org is impressively well run with intention to improve for staff’s needs.
cons: As a large and fairly complex nonprofit, things naturally become fast paced at times. It is an ambitious, high achieving work place which can result in some intense work periods, but they can be managed.

pros: Your work are aprreciated and acknowledged
cons: You had no right to log on to

pros: Warm and welcoming colleagues. Great atmosphere.
cons: Can't think of any now

pros: Amazing place to work, everyone in the staff is smart and very committed to the work. The executive leadership team is very supportive of staff, and quickly pivoted to new ways of working during COVID. The CEO is truly visionary, and a very effective leader. A truly fantastic place to work!
cons: The organization is growing fast, and at times workload can be quite intense.

review_title: Good structure, experience dependent on team
pros: Your experience as an employee seems highly dependent on your team, but overall, there is opportunity for growth and flexibility.
cons: Very hierarchical, more work needed in the realm of DEI.

pros: Working at Room to Read has been one of the best experiences of my life. This organization is working on some of the largest and hardest issues, and I have never worked anywhere that can do that and also care so much about its own people. The world has been a hard place these last couple years and the team and its leadership has done everything it can to focus on the mission and be kind to people even if individual circumstances can't always be addressed. I love how committed everyone is to doing their best.
cons: There is always more to do. I think that is just the reality of trying to change such big things. I'd like to see more people taking ownership of their priorities and communications.

review_title: A great organization to work for
pros:
Women centric and friendly environment
A great scope to grow
cons: High Pressure during events, reviews

pros: Learning of new experiences is prossible
cons: Working from home has been challenging.

review_title: Great mission & staff, but burn out/minimal growth opps
pros: Some of my favorite people I’ve ever worked with were/are here. The org attracts globally-minded people who were great to be around. Great mission and ultra dedicated staff. HR genuinely makes a strong effort to build org culture more than any other place I’ve worked.
cons:
Heavy workload for not great pay comparatively, unnecessary urgency on frequent unforeseen projects, and very little room for promotion-all of which led to burn out for me personally. Some of the HQ leadership also has a rather high school cliquish vibe which seemed to lead to some higher ups not protecting their team’s bandwidth.

I’d also note the promotion track here is unusually slow compared to other places I’ve been.

review_title: Great mission, great people, great work, poor leadership.
pros: The work this organization does is very important and has wide impact in areas where the help is desperately needed.  I had the opportunity to work with people in places I would never have otherwise thought of.  The staff are very dedicated (almost to a fault) and are great to work with.
cons: Poor leadership and executive-level management.  It seemed that executive-level management was of the mindset that they set the agenda and developed all of the plans and everyone else was there simply to execute on their plans.  Staff was never brought into the decision-making process and executive management seemed to get defensive when their decisions were questioned or challenged.  They failed to take advantage of the expertise of the people they hire and trust them to make decisions, which resulted in high turn-over and low morale.  There was a complete lack of cohesion between executive-level managers; they didn't seem to like working with each other and this had a "trickle-down" effect to middle-level managers and line staff.

review_title: My experience in room to read has been learning journey...
pros: I learned a lot from my colleagues at all level be it my peer group,my supervisor,management team, support function(HR & finance) and even from the global team. Every person in this organisation is so passionate and you only realise the worth of the work culture at RTR India after you leave and join any other organisation.
cons: Since the time I joined I have just experienced too many change in the program design.... This makes a new employee feel gittery if the GO is just experimenting or if they are not clear what will work at the field level.it is only the HR team who acts as steward of the culture and funnel down the global HR behaviour but other team heads also need to start behaving in the same way.

pros: Love the mission, the people are very special and the work life balance is good. I enjoy the team i work with and get a fair amount of freedom about my work.
cons: Senior management is stuck in the past and needs to react more quickly to a changing world. There are a lot of very sharp young people who can not get exciting and helpful programs off the ground. No real opportunity for advancement and far to structured a promotion program and talent is not rewarded.

pros: Great place to work; people are dedicated and very hard working. Leadership is strong; new CEO is dynamic and highly strategic.  Appreciate the supportive culture and focus on quantifying results. Lots of fun employee events, like books swaps and educational brown-bag lunches.  Also like the constant connection between the work and the outcomes that are presented. This really keeps you motivated to do more!
cons: Budgets are much leaner than those in the corporate sector. Open office configuration may be challenging for those who are used to a bit more privacy.

review_title: Salary is good work environment is moderate,very tall org hirerchy puts supervising authority to inappropriate ppl.
pros: Good mission vision,noble cause,good HR practices(though insiders rarely acknowledge them) ,amazing leadership by Bangladeshi former CD
cons:
Fear of insiders to make use of opportunities like work from home ,for unknown reason ppl believe its just unprofessional !!!
Unnecessary outdoor meetings -senior mgt all of who live in one city travel to another city for sr mgt level mtg every month,moreover ppl of head office are unnecessarily dragged to another place (mostly distant) for trg or workshops!!!!
Tall hiererchy increases leadership inefficiency and poor delivery of mgt views,after all everyone is not comfortable with such responsibility nor has the patience n skill to render it effectively.

review_title: Amazing mission, vibrant new CEO and wonderful staff.....
pros: The mission at Room to Read is simple, yet powerful:  world change starts with educated children.  The new CEO is brilliant and motivated to grow the impact that we have worldwide.  The staff here are great - it's a collaborative group of people who work hard, but still bring joy to the workplace every day.
cons: It's a non-profit and budgets are constrained.  With 1600 staff worldwide, it's sometimes difficult to communicate globally.  Many staff are out in the field teaching at schools in rural areas, so getting information broadly disseminated can be a challenge.

review_title: I've learned more in my 3 years at Room to Read than I have in my prior 10 years of experience combined
pros: Fun, passionate, driven, talented staff combined with a mission that speaks to my heart. Stretch opportunities galore. Never, ever bored. Beer cart Friday - enough said!
cons: Given its age in the growth cycle of an org, Room to Read is in its "adolescence". We're no longer a start-up, but we're also not quite yet a mature organization. We're still learning to put in the infrastructure, systems and processes in place to catch up with our growth, which sometimes results in some growing pains. But, we're getting there!

review_title: Great Place to Work, Inspiring Mission & People
pros: I've really enjoyed my time here. It's easy to get excited about what you're doing when the mission/vision is so powerful (and that Room to Read makes an effort to do such quality and sustainable work). I've worked with someone from every department and can honestly say my colleagues are incredibly hard working and brilliant and fun, and my supervisor consistently provides me with opportunities for professional growth and development.
cons: Being a nonprofit, there are budgetary restrictions - have to have that dedication to the mission & commitment to collaboration & innovation to do your best work!

pros: Exhausting, great learning experience, picked up a lot of skills in the office, and everyday had a new challenge.  I had the opportunity to do international projects- it is what you can make of the experience, don't expect any mentorship. Great training opportunities.
cons: Bad leadership, terrible office culture, HR is not trustworthy and makes terrible hiring decisions or manage change. Too many leadership changes will hamper growth.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Forward thinking, progressive organization with passion driven, intelligent worldwide team. Strong leadership with diverse talent ranging from the for-profit and nonprofit sector. Best of both sectors- run like a business and yet, has a feel good mission that staff are proud to represent.  Great place to work.
cons: Work hours often occur outside of normal business hours; fast paced work environment with high expectations. Burn out is a frequent occurrence. Upward mobility options limited due to medium size of organization.

review_title: It is amazing!!! Its a dream organization. I would want to retire form this organization.
pros: Best HR Practices. Very good work culture. Very approcable management. Work is very good and the impact is very satisfied.Lot of decentralization from procurements to HR SPOC.
cons: Too many changes, Regional office next door with too much interference.

review_title: A look at Room to Read regional operations
pros:
- The work within early childhood education is absolutely beautiful
- Great network to work with globally; there's a real sense of comradery
cons: Regional management is marred by a great sense of distrust that trickles down to program and technical staff. There's a lot of concern about the management approach, coupled by a multitude of HR issues which takes away focus from the mission work, impairing collaborative efforts and productivity.

review_title: Recommend as a great place to work
pros: The quality and talent of the staff Room to Read attracts and retains is one of the greatest perks of working here. The people are passionate about Room to Read's mission, innovative, and results oriented. It is inspiring and motivating to be surrounded by such amazing colleagues.
cons: As with most successful organizations, a lot is expected of staff and the bar for performance is high. But, that is why this organization has achieved such amazing results.

pros: The mission of Room to Read is amazing and as an organization, they're making tremendous impact. The employees who work there (worldwide) are smart, interesting, and hard-working. I was proud when I told people where I worked and what I did.
cons: There were unrealistic expectations about what could be accomplished in a given time frame and the resources available to do so.

pros: Room to Read has amazing people who work there - at the global office in SF and all around the world.  There's an appetite for risk-taking and people are supportive of one another.
cons: Some departments are thinly staffed making workload crazy at various points of the year.  The Management Team is rather weak at the moment, but hopefully that will change soon.

review_title: Organization working for a great cause
pros:
- Good Organisation to work
- Global Office is easily accessible
- Great cause
- Nice people to work with
cons:
- Hopeless HR. HR is not aligned with the Organization vision and mission.
- Not easy to survive in India Country Office unless you are good in building and maintaining good relationship with the super powerful CMT.

pros:
*Flexible Hours
*Ability to work remotely
*Great Global Community/Resource meetings
*Everything from HR to Marketing is streamlined globally
*Good senior leadership
cons:
*Would be hard to work for another NGO after working here
*Sometimes resources are very stretched given how lean some of the Global teams are

review_title: Burn out organization, 60% turn over and VERY little career/salary growth opportunities for non leadership roles.
job_title: External Relations in San Francisco, CA
pros: The staff in middle and lower leadership positions have a sense of humor and make the job fun. The entry level staff enjoy this fun culture and helps retain their commitment and loyalty to the organization. The Co-Founders and Board of Directors are passionate about the mission. This inspires great financial support from Boards of Directors in global markets and Major Gifts Donors to advance the work.
cons: The organization hires very green staff at low salary levels and fails to create a culture nor organizational budget where people can advance in responsibility and particularly in compensation. This creates a revolving door effect and 60% turn over especially in the External Relations Department, and fund raising team.  Many of the staff shared with me that they do not enjoy working with the Co-Founders and find them to be very inflexible, married to their jobs and unwilling to create work life balance for their staff.  While the Executive Team members enjoy high salaries, line staff are often brought in under market rate, and move on in the pursuit of salary growth offered elsewhere since RtR is not competitive with the market.  This organization is less than 10% supported by Annual Fund Raising, and unfortunately is dominated by the interests of handful of powerful large donors instead of being broadly supported by the public.

review_title: Good organization with room to grow
pros: Room to Read only hires the most passionate, committed people, and everyone is all around fun to work with.  The people are definitely the biggest asset.
cons: Not a lot of professional development opportunities or work life balance.

review_title: Excellent group of dedicated, smart people
job_title: Program Officer in San Francisco, CA
pros: Fantastic colleagues, great travel opportunities, if you love this work there aren't many places like it in San Francisco.  High standards for quality of work, work ethic.
cons: Very little mentorship (b/c there are very few truly senior people on staff), limited career growth.  Can be very demanding depending on your team/position.  You're expected to perform at 100% all the time.

pros: to gain more experience in finance department through meeting with different people at ROOM TO READ who are well trained and experienced
cons: to get  used with the working  environment at ROOM TO READ

pros: Good colleagues, young and agile organisatiin. Competitive donor driven programmes.

review_title: Amazing place to learn, grow and be challenged
pros: My colleagues are smart, driven, passionate, and fun! The work is meaningful and I am pushed professionally, but with appropriate support.

review_title: Great mission, great people, broken systems

review_title: Great place to be challenged and grow professionally
